s11: This is why Confucius clarified the way of kings, petitioned more than seventy rulers, but none could employ him. Therefore he observed the western Zhou court, discussed historical records and old traditions, arose in Lu and arranged the Spring and Autumn Annals, recording from Yin above to the capture of the unicorn in Ai below, condensing their wording and style, removing their tedious repetitions, to establish righteous principles. The way of kings was complete, human affairs thorough.
s12: The disciples of the seventy worthies orally received his transmitted teachings, for there were passages of criticism, mockery, praise, concealment, and depreciation in the wording that could not be shown in writing.
s13: The Lu gentleman Zuoqiu Ming feared that disciples would each follow different doctrines, each comfortable with their own opinions, losing the truth, so based on Confucius's historical records he comprehensively discussed their sayings, completing the Zuo Tradition Spring and Autumn Annals.
s14: Duo Jiao wrote a commentary for King Wei of Chu, but the king could not read the entire Spring and Autumn Annals, so he selected successes and failures, finally making forty chapters, calling it the Duo Family Annals.
s15: In the time of King Xiaocheng of Zhao, his chancellor Yu Qing selected from the Spring and Autumn Annals above and observed recent trends below, also writing eight chapters, calling it the Yu Family Spring and Autumn Annals.
